description: An illustration of the sculpture "Quatre Blancs" (1976) by artist Alexander Calder. The sculpture consists of several pieces of thin metal in various shapes: the base is made up of a black triangular piece that has an S-curved right side with a red, roughly rectangular piece that tapers to a triangular point placed perpendicular to the black triangular piece; a thin red rod balances on the tip of the triangular base; a blue circle connects to the left end of the rod; the right end of the rod connects to three smaller red metal rods with four white roughly triangular shapes attached.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
